column4: I have no idea why my menus are drawn so slowly... I think I'll just do format and reinstall. If I have a several months old "Ubuntu 7.04" cd should I bother downloading a new one?
have you checked the swap?
What might be wrong with the swap? It's twice my RAM, i. e. 2 GB, and usually quite empty.
My swap got turned off when i messed with some partitions and everything got really slow
you can check in System Monitor and Gparted
Well, I messed with my partition and everything got erased, while I don't think my swap is turned off I read from HDD a lot. And I can see the menus and windows slowly being drawn. And text is slow.
just check in system monitor if swap is activated
It says Used swap: 0 bytes of 1.9 GB
Where would I activate it?
great, then thats the problem
It is?
did you move your swap partition and now your hibernation is not working either?
if so, you are in for a TREAT :D It takes some effort to fix
I didn't try hibernating and I didn't touch swap after creating it during install

ok ill try to find this link i used to get it working, just a sec. You can do the command "swapon" to activate, but to permanently fix it takes some effort. And be careful! Dont do swapon on the wrong partition!
swapon: /dev/sda1: Device or resource busy
Oh, also, when I right click sda1 in gparted "swapoff" shows up.
you sure that sda1 is swap? Sound a bit fishy to me but you probably know
check this out http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=456992
you can do swapon in gparted by right clicking aswell
gotta go to solve my own problems, that thread should help you. good luck!
Ok, thanks
